instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message:
Got MacBook Air A2337 with prohibition symbol. Thought was easy only to restore in DFU and indeed worked.
After testing everything looked good till I put the machine in standby, I see again the restore symbol on the screen.

Basically I realised that I can use normal  the machine but as soon I turn it off or put it in stand by after closing the screen, the MacBook goes in a boot loop.
Precisely restarts by itself and shows the prohibition symbol and I cannot go in option menu, just keeps boot looping till I dfu restore it again.

I did not work much on this board, but looks in mind condition inside. Any idea what could be wrong?

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did this happen after trying macOS upgrade?

Try to install original macOS version; start with SHIFT + OPTION + COMMAND + R.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message:
how do I install original macOS version from the power button menu of M1?
starting with SHIFT + OPTION + COMMAND + R, doesn't work just boots into Macinstosh HD

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message:
Sorry, it is M1...
Test its SSD on Disk Utility.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message: Gives no issues. I have to restore the machine in DFU if I put in stand by for longer than 30 min more or less, if there battery goes low, or if I turn it off. Machine was not in use from 1 year, but inside is like new

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message: What said the client about how the problem appeared?

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message: No information available sadly. Has not been in use from a year and no water damage

threads.title: Macbook A2337 820-02016 restore issue
threads.message:
Change security settings to allow USB boot.
Then boot Big Sur, or Monterey from USB; lets see if is software issue.
